userStories.title: Swagger/OpenAPI Annotations for Priority Routes
userStories.description: As an API developer, I want complete Swagger/OpenAPI documentation at /api-docs showing all endpoints with request/response schemas.
acceptanceCriteria: IMPORTANT: Code is at ventus-voice/frontend/src/ and ventus-voice/backend/src/ (NOT root frontend/ or backend/)
Find the Swagger setup in ventus-voice/backend/src/ (likely src/docs/swagger.ts or similar)

Add @openapi JSDoc annotations to the following route files in ventus-voice/backend/src/routes/: brands.routes.ts, mcp-catalog.routes.ts, mcp-connections.routes.ts, custom-functions.routes.ts, knowledge-base.routes.ts
Each annotation must include: summary, description, tags, parameters (path/query), requestBody schema (where applicable), responses (200/400/401/500) with schema definitions
Use proper OpenAPI 3.0 schema references ($ref) where shared types exist
Add schema definitions for: BrandAnalysisResult (with new audienceAnalysis, competitorAnalysis, vocabulary, useCaseScenarios fields), MCPCatalogItem, MCPConnection, CustomFunction, KnowledgeBase
Tag groups: Brands, MCP, Functions, Knowledge Base
Auth requirements: mark protected routes with security: [{ bearerAuth: [] }]
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Completed: Added 3 new tags (Brands, MCP, Functions) and 3 new schema definitions (BrandAnalysisResult with audienceAnalysis/competitorAnalysis/vocabulary/useCaseScenarios, MCPCatalogItem, MCPConnection) to swagger.ts. Added @openapi JSDoc annotations to all routes in: brands.routes.ts (7 endpoints), mcp-catalog.routes.ts (3 endpoints), mcp-connections.routes.ts (6 endpoints), custom-functions.routes.ts (12 endpoints), knowledge-base.routes.ts (11 endpoints). Each annotation includes summary, description, tags, parameters, requestBody schemas, and responses (200/400/401/403/404/500) with $ref to shared schemas. Protected routes marked with security: [{ ClerkJWT: [] }]. Typecheck passes (no new errors; pre-existing errors in unrelated files only).

userStories.title: In-App FAQ Expansion

acceptanceCriteria: IMPORTANT: Code is at ventus-voice/frontend/src/ and ventus-voice/backend/src/ (NOT root frontend/ or backend/)
Find DocumentationPage.tsx in ventus-voice/frontend/src/pages/

Add 10 new FAQ items covering: (1) MCP Marketplace browsing and connecting, (2) Flow Studio creating and testing flows, (3) Memory System layers and RIF scoring, (4) Forge URL Wizard vs Interview Bot, (5) Knowledge Base uploading and RAG search, (6) Custom Functions creation and assignment, (7) Analytics call data and session transcripts, (8) Voice Library TTS/STT providers, (9) Billing minutes and plan upgrades, (10) Embed/Deploy agent to website
Each FAQ item has a clear question as title and a helpful 2-4 sentence answer

userStories.title: Platform Deployment Tutorials
userStories.description: As a user deploying an agent, I want step-by-step tutorials for embedding my agent on Shopify, WordPress, Webflow, and React/Next.js.
acceptanceCriteria: IMPORTANT: Code is at ventus-voice/frontend/src/ and ventus-voice/backend/src/ (NOT root frontend/ or backend/)
Find or create a deployment tutorials section in the frontend - either add to the existing DocumentationPage.tsx or create a new DeploymentTutorialsPage.tsx in ventus-voice/frontend/src/pages/
If creating a new page: add route /docs/deployment-tutorials in App.tsx and link from DocumentationPage
Create 4 tutorial sections: Shopify, WordPress, Webflow, React/Next.js
Shopify tutorial: explain opening theme editor, navigating to theme.liquid, pasting script tag in <head>, verifying widget appears
WordPress tutorial: explain using Appearance > Theme Editor or a header/footer plugin, pasting script tag, clearing cache, verifying
Webflow tutorial: explain opening Project Settings > Custom Code, pasting in Head Code section, publishing, verifying
React/Next.js tutorial: explain installing npm package (or using script tag), importing component, adding to layout, passing agent ID prop
Each tutorial has: prerequisites list, numbered step-by-step instructions, a code snippet showing the embed code, a troubleshooting tip
Use Vora branding in all embed snippets (VoraWidget, voicevora.com, etc.)
Tutorials render in both light and dark themes
Typecheck passes
